page.title: 04KENN AND KENNFORD FARMING 2
page.content: THE FARMS OF THIS AREA DATE BACK IN MANY INSTANCES MANY HUNDREDS OF YEARS.THIS CAN BE SEEN BY NAMES SUCH AS HOLLOWAY BARTON,THE WORD BARTON BEING A LOCAL TERM FOR MEANING CORNFARM. CERTAIN FARMERS HAVE BEEN FORCED BY ECONOMICS TO CHANGE FROM DAIRY CATTLE TO BEEF CATTLE. THE REASON BEING THAT AS DAIRY CATTLE REQUIRE MILKING TWICE A DAY THEY ARE MORE LABOUR INTENSIVE THAN BEEF CATTLE REARED PURELY FOR THEIR MEAT. THIS ALETATION CAN BE SEEN IN THE CHANGES INSIDE FARM BUILDINGS.SHEEP ARE ALSO KEPT WITH LAMBS BEING BORN AROUND CHRISTMAS TIME.THE WOOLEN INDUSTRY THRIVES IN OTHER PARTS OF THE COUNTY AS SMALL CRAFTSMEN REVIVE COTTAGE INDUSTRIES CONCERNED WITH THE SPINNING,WEAVING AND DYING OF WOOL.
